title: Sample Schema
description: Metadata schema for samples at NSLS-II

sample_group_PI.description: The principle investigator of the group making the sample.

collaborators.description: Other members of the sample making team.

sample_prep_start_date.description: The date the sample preparation began.

chemical_formula.description: Chemical formula, if known, of the sample constituent.

chemical_name_common.description: Common name(s), if any, of the sample constituent.

chemical_name_mineral.description: Mineral name(s), if any, of the sample constituent.

phase_state.description: The phase state(s), such as powder or solution, that the sample constituent is in.

cif_url.description: The URL to the crystallographic information of the sample constituent.

cif_database_id.description: The database ID for the crystallographic information from the CIF database.

tags.description: Users may enter in tags for personal use.

diameter_mm.description: The diamater of the container in millimeters.

length_mm.description: The length of the container in millimeters.

in_beam_constituents.description: Container constituents that are intended to be within the range of the beam.

chemical_formula.description: Chemical formula, if known, of the container constituent.

chemical_name_common.description: Common name(s), if any, of the container constituent.

chemical_name_mineral.description: Mineral name(s), if any, of the container constituent.

sample_dilutant.description: The name of the sample dilutant(s), if any are present.

out_of_beam_constituents.description: Container constituents that are intended to be outside the range of the beam.

name.description: The name of the container constituent.

description.description: A description of the container constituent.

chemical_formula.description: Chemical formula, if known, of the container constituent.

chemical_name_common.description: Common name(s), if any, of the container constituent.

chemical_name_mineral.description: Mineral name(s), if any, of the container constituent.
